SUMMARY:
Let me inform Amanda I have spent some of my education in segregated schools as I am an immigrant.
My beautiful religion Islam teaches exactly this, to love my country and remain loyal to my country.
Islamic values are not very different from British values.
Mutual respect for and tolerance of those with different faiths is part of the British values.
I am a qualified science teacher with a Masters in education, planning on completing a doctorate in education.
TEXT:
Ofsted stated segregation in a Birmingham Islamic faith school left girls 'unprepared for life in modern Britain'. On which research did Ofsted's Amanda Spielman make this statement?

Let me inform Amanda I have spent some of my education in segregated schools as I am an immigrant. I am now a secondary school science teacher who covers her head in accordance with her religion. I organise numerous activities whilst being part of the Ahmadiyya Muslim Women's Association, UK. Only yesterday I organised an event involving raising awareness of the poppy appeal in allegiance with the Royal British Legion. Last year I organised a charity walk raising money for the 'War Child' charity. Visiting sick children in hospitals and giving them presents at the occasion of Christmas is a regular occurrence. Most women who are part of the Ahmadiyya Muslim Women's Association help out in such events throughout the country. We as a community are guided by our spiritual leader, Hazrat Mirza Masroor Ahmad, who regularly reminds us of the true teachings of Islam which are devoid of violence and extremism.

Am I not upholding British values? Do I look like I am "unprepared for life in modern Britain"? Of course not!

I immigrated to England because I was not allowed to practice my religion freely in Pakistan. After my immigration, I call England my home. I love England. It gives me so much security and allows me to practice my own religion without any fear. My beautiful religion Islam teaches exactly this, to love my country and remain loyal to my country.

Islamic values are not very different from British values. As a teacher I try my utmost to ensure my pupils gain British values and become good citizens of the UK. Mutual respect for and tolerance of those with different faiths is part of the British values. I myself encourage mutual respect in my pupils as is expected of teachers. Islam is not different from British values. Islam tolerates and allows everyone to practice their own religion without fear.

Surely the whole point of a faith school is for children to grow up in an environment which adheres to their religion. I understand sex discrimination is an important law and when exercised appropriately is a necessity to ensure men and women are treated equally. The faith school stated boys and girls were treated equally despite being segregated. Segregation does not hinder education, so why should schools be given lower Ofsted ratings if they chose to segregate pupils? Segregation certainly didn't hinder my education. I am a qualified science teacher with a Masters in education, planning on completing a doctorate in education.

Let me tell you I feel so comfortable when I am in a separate ladies area at my mosque. Yet I have fully integrated within the British society. It is possible to do both!
TITLE: A Reply From A Muslim Woman Who Had A Segregated Education

Â¿Hay condiciones para que en 2018 se destrabe esta situaciÃ³n o por el contrario, se podrÃ­a agravar aÃºn mÃ¡s con el proceso electoral?, preguntÃ³ el HuffPost.
Un problema que condiciona estructuras polÃ­ticas que a su vez fomenta fenÃ³menos como la desigualdad, donde los mÃ¡s pobres son tambiÃ©n los mÃ¡s perjudicados por la corrupciÃ³n.
TEXT:
La desconfianza ciudadana en las instituciones del Estado es un cÃ­rculo vicioso que podrÃ­a conducir a los mexicanos a perder la batalla contra la corrupciÃ³n y la impunidad. Esto, ante el riesgo de que los sistemas y controles anticorrupciÃ³n sean secuestrados en su totalidad por grupos polÃ­ticos que se disputarÃ¡n el poder en las elecciones de 2018.

Estas fueron algunas de las principales conclusiones de acadÃ©micos y funcionarios que participaron en el sexto Seminario Internacional Poder, corrupciÃ³n e impunidad: una agenda con enfoque de derechos, organizado por la Red por la RendiciÃ³n de Cuentas. Un evento al cual asistieron los titulares de organismos como la AuditorÃ­a Superior de la FederaciÃ³n (ASF), la SecretarÃ­a de la FunciÃ³n PÃºblica (SFP), el Instituto Nacional de Acceso a la InformaciÃ³n (INAI) y el Instituto Nacional Electoral (INE).

"La participaciÃ³n ciudadana ha asumido este reto y plantea a las instituciones gubernamentales una serie de desafÃ­os para lograr una relaciÃ³n distinta entre sociedad y gobierno", dijo Juan Manuel Portal, titular de la AuditorÃ­a Superior de la FederaciÃ³n.

Esto es especialmente importante al existir un clima de desconfianza y escepticismo respecto a la actuaciÃ³n del Estado". Juan Manuel Portal, titular de la ASF

El auditor seÃ±alÃ³ que, en algunos casos, con los Sistemas AnticorrupciÃ³n a nivel estatal se han pretendido implementar estructuras paralelas a los canales oficiales bajo el supuesto de que la ciudadanizaciÃ³n del Sistema pasa por dotar a estas instancias de atribuciones similares a las de las instituciones gubernamentales.

Debemos, por esta razÃ³n, estar en guardia para que el Sistema Nacional AnticorrupciÃ³n no se vea sujeto a ese tipo de presiones que, en Ãºltimo tÃ©rmino, mermen su credibilidad o lleguen, en casos extremos, a coptar su actuaciÃ³n a favor de intereses personales o de grupo". Juan Manuel Portal, titular de la ASF

Un punto en el que coincide Mauricio Merino, coordinador del Programa Interdisciplinario de RendiciÃ³n de Cuentas del CIDE, quien considera que existe un riesgo latente de que los sistemas y controles anticorrupciÃ³n queden inservibles ante la voracidad de los partidos y la disputa por el poder.

"El riesgo en el que estamos es que la ausencia de respaldo social para hacer valer todos estos sistemas amenaza su vigencia, porque puede quedar, como estÃ¡ empezando a suceder, capturados por quienes se oponen a ellos desde el corazÃ³n del rÃ©gimen polÃ­ticos y de partidos que hemos construido", dijo Merino.

Mucho me temo que si perdemos esta batalla vamos a tener una regresiÃ³n autoritaria muy seria". Mauricio Merino, coordinador PIRC-CIDE

Merino menciona varios ejemplos que ilustran esta situaciÃ³n. El primero de ellos, asegura, tiene que ver con que el sistema nacional de archivos no estÃ¡ completo, ante la falta de una Ley General de Archivos, que tiene ya una larga demora en el Congreso sin "una explicaciÃ³n vÃ¡lida para que no salga". "La disputa que hay ahÃ­ es que la SecretarÃ­a de GobernaciÃ³n no ha querido renunciar al control de todos los archivos del paÃ­s y que se sigue imponiendo la tesis del control sobre los datos personales incluso en documentos del siglo XIX. Ese debate estÃ¡ atorado en el Congreso", apunta el experto.

Otro ejemplo tiene que ver con los huecos que ha dejado el Sistema Nacional AnticorrupciÃ³n o la manera en que el presidente Enrique PeÃ±a Nieto enviÃ³ nombres para la postulaciÃ³n de magistrados de las salas central y regionales especializadas en materia anticorrupciÃ³n.

"Nunca nos dijeron de dÃ³nde salieron esos nombres, cuÃ¡l fue la mecÃ¡nica, por quÃ© los designaron a ellos. Ni tampoco el Senado estÃ¡ respondiendo quÃ© va a hacer con esos nombres. Simplemente los va a negociar polÃ­ticamente", dijo Merino.

Â¿Hay condiciones para que en 2018 se destrabe esta situaciÃ³n o por el contrario, se podrÃ­a agravar aÃºn mÃ¡s con el proceso electoral?, preguntÃ³ el HuffPost.

"No lo sÃ©", respondiÃ³ Merino. "Hay un empate, una tal desconfianza, una cantidad de encono, tal ambiciÃ³n, codicia de los intermediarios polÃ­ticos, que con frecuencia pienso que la capacidad de respuesta de la sociedad civil, que fue emocionante y conmovedora el 19 de septiembre, despuÃ©s vuelve a la normalidad: desencanto, apatÃ­a, falta de cohesiÃ³n, intereses personales, pleitos... y eso mina nuestra capacidad de responder a todos estos desafÃ­os", agregÃ³.

La desconfianza se convierte en un cÃ­rculo vicioso: entre mÃ¡s desconfiamos menos participamos y mÃ¡s espacios le damos a los intermediarios polÃ­ticos y a los corruptos. Y en consecuencia mÃ¡s desconfianza se produce. Es un cÃ­rculo vicioso que debemos romper de alguna manera". Mauricio Merino, PIRC-CIDE

Un problema que incluso es reconocido por las autoridades encargadas de organizar las elecciones de 2018.

"La corrupciÃ³n y la impunidad, dos de los grandes problemas nacionales de nuestro tiempo, son prÃ¡cticas que estÃ¡n corroyendo a la sociedad mexicana y que poco a poco estÃ¡n mermando la convivencia social, la cohesiÃ³n social", afirma Lorenzo CÃ³rdova, consejero presidente del Instituto Nacional Electoral.

Pero a pesar de los avances institucionales en materia electoral, CÃ³rdova reconoce que el sistema de fiscalizaciÃ³n con el que cuenta el INE todavÃ­a tiene "fronteras por alcanzar" a la hora de identificar el origen y destino de recursos ilÃ­citos que se inyectan a las campaÃ±as polÃ­ticas.

"Llevamos tres aÃ±os de desarrollo de ese sistema, y aunque todavÃ­a hay fronteras por alcanzar, creo que es posible afirmar que el modelo de fiscalizaciÃ³n vigente hoy en dÃ­a permite una mayor claridad sobre el origen y destino de cada peso que ingresa a la competencia electoral y que deja huella en la vÃ­a pÃºblica o el sistema financiero. Pero vuelvo a insistir, tambiÃ©n aquÃ­ hay fronteras importantÃ­simas por alcanzar", concluyÃ³ CÃ³rdova.

Y esto se debe en buena medida, al pacto de impunidad que existe entre las Ã©lites polÃ­ticas que controlan al paÃ­s.

"Tenemos en todo el marco de corrupciÃ³n con inadecuados marcos legales, falta de capacidades institucionales, un muy deficiente sistema de justicia que cada vez se manifiesta con mayor claridad y tenemos un pacto de impunidad entre los actores polÃ­ticos", seÃ±alÃ³ Jacqueline Peschard, titular del ComitÃ© de ParticipaciÃ³n Ciudadana del Sistema Nacional AnticorrupciÃ³n.

"De cara al 2018 sÃ­ tenemos que poner Ã©nfasis en los actores polÃ­ticos. Cuando vemos los delitos electorales que derivan de actos de corrupciÃ³n, pensamos que es por una deficiente acciÃ³n de la autoridad electoral y olvidamos poner el foco de atenciÃ³n en los actores polÃ­ticos", agregÃ³.

En este sentido, Peschard indicÃ³ que casos de corrupciÃ³n como los exgobernadores del PRI Eugenio HernÃ¡ndez o Javier Duarte, no son casos donde participa una sola persona, sino que se trata de todo "una red de complicidades".

Un problema que condiciona estructuras polÃ­ticas que a su vez fomenta fenÃ³menos como la desigualdad, donde los mÃ¡s pobres son tambiÃ©n los mÃ¡s perjudicados por la corrupciÃ³n.

"Los mÃ¡s ricos se benefician mÃ¡s de la corrupciÃ³n, mientras los mÃ¡s pobres son los que mÃ¡s la padecen", apunta Hans Mathieu, director de la FundaciÃ³n Friedich Ebert Stiftung MÃ©xico.

TITLE: La desconfianza es un cÃ­rculo vicioso que podrÃ­a conducirnos a perder la batalla contra la corrupciÃ³n y el autoritarismo

TEXT:
Spain is to sack Cataloniaâ€™s Government and curb its parliamentâ€™s powers as it tries to stop the regionâ€™s independence bid, after a referendum that was marred by police violence.

Prime Minister Mariano Rajoy announced he would take the unprecedented action after an emergency cabinet meeting in Madrid on Saturday.

It comes nearly three weeks after the referendum, which Spanish courts had deemed illegal, saw police clash with voters, confiscate polling boxes and force their way into polling stations.

GABRIEL BOUYS via Getty Images Spanish Prime Minister Mariano Rajoy invoked Article 155 of the country's constitution for the first time in his move to suspend Catalonia's government

Of the 43% who voted, 90% backed independence and the region announced it was moving ahead with declaring its separation from Spain.

Rajoy stopped short of suspending Cataloniaâ€™s parliament but his move means there must be fresh elections within six months.

He invoked Article 155 of Spainâ€™s constitution, which allows it to suspend the powers of autonomous regions in times of crisis.

â€œWe are not ending Catalan autonomy, but we are relieving of their duties those who have acted outside the law,â€ Rajoy said.

David Ramos via Getty Images Police clash with voters in Sant Julia De Ramis on the day of the referendum

It comes after Madrid ordered Carles Puigdemontâ€™s government to clarify whether it had declared independence.

The Catalan leader did not answer but said he would declare independence if the Spanish Government invoked Article 155.

Catalan MEP Ramon Tremosa reacted by saying Rajoy had â€œsuspended democracyâ€ in the region.
TITLE: Catalonia's Government To Be Sacked In Post-Independence Referendum Clampdown By Madrid

Seit der 2014 war Rakka die Hochburg der Terrororganisation Islamischer Staat. Nach monatelangen KÃ¤mpfen gelang es den Syrischen Demokratischen KrÃ¤ften (SDF), die Stadt zurÃ¼ckzuerobern â€“ oder das, was noch davon Ã¼brig geblieben ist.

Denn Rakka liegt nach den KÃ¤mpfen in Schutt und Asche.

Wie sehr die Stadt und ihre Menschen unter den KÃ¤mpfen gelitten haben, wird auf Fotos deutlich, die auf der Seite "Raqqa is Being Slaughtered Silently" auf Facebook gepostet wurden. Dahinter steckt eine Kampagne, die sich seit drei Jahren gegen die Macht des IS in Rakka stark gemacht hat.



Knapp vier Monate dauerte der Krieg um die Stadt zwischen dem IS und den SDF. An diesem Dienstag kapitulierten die letzten Radikalen des Islamischen Staates, als Mitglieder der kurdisch dominierten SDF auf das GelÃ¤nde vordrangen. Sie hatten sich im einstigen Krankenhaus der Stadt verschanzt.

Der Kampf um Rakka zwang tausende Menschen, die Stadt zu verlassen und forderte unzÃ¤hlige Leben. Von 27.000 Toten geht die Hilfsorganisation â€œSave the Childrenâ€ aus.

Die Stadt, in der zuvor 200.000 Menschen lebten, ist grÃ¶ÃŸtenteils zerstÃ¶rt worden und deshalb unbewohnbar.

Charley Gallay via Getty Images

El escÃ¡ndalo Harvey Weinstein ya cuenta con 47 mujeres que han acusado al productor de abusos. Sin embargo, una de las figuras de las que se esperaba un posicionamiento sobre lo ocurrido era Quentin Tarantino, uno de los directores de cabecera del productor y de su empresa Miramax. El cineasta de Pulp Fiction contÃ³ el pasado jueves 19 de octubre en una entrevista a The New York Times que era consciente de la conducta sexual de Weinstein.

"SabÃ­a lo suficiente para hacer mÃ¡s de lo que hice", afirma Tarantino. "Era mucho mÃ¡s que rumores y cotilleos. No era ninguna tonterÃ­a, sabÃ­a que habÃ­a hecho alguna de esas cosas". Los abusos de Weinstein fueron destapados por un artÃ­culo de The New York Times donde se denunciaba el acoso y, al menos en seis casos, la presunta violaciÃ³n de diversas actrices por parte del productor.

"OjalÃ¡ hubiese tomado responsabilidad sobre lo que estaba ocurriendo. Si hubiese hecho lo que debÃ­a entonces, no habrÃ­a trabajado con Ã©l", confiesa el director, quien se muestra arrepentido de haber continuado haciendo pelÃ­culas con Weinstein cuando era consciente del abuso al que sometÃ­a a varias actrices.

En la entrevista el cineasta se disculpa por su comportamiento durante estos aÃ±os mÃ¡s que explicar el porquÃ© de su actitud. "Cualquier cosa que diga ahora puede parecer una excusa", recalca Tarantino, quien aÃ±ade que lo que hacÃ­a era "aislar los incidentes".

A pesar de esto, el director sabÃ­a de primera mano los abusos sobre su expareja Mira Sorvino (Poderosa Afrodita). Sorvino le habÃ­a contado los episodios con el productor quien llegÃ³ a perseguirla por un hotel y a masajearla sin su consentimiento. "Esto acabÃ³ cuando empezamos a salir, no querÃ­a problemas con mi novia", argumenta Tarantino.

Las declaraciones de Tarantino llegan una semana despuÃ©s de que la actriz Amber Tamblyn manifestase en Twitter la opiniÃ³n del director, que, segÃºn la publicaciÃ³n, se mostraba "conmocionado y descorazonado" y necesitaba tiempo para procesar "el dolor" y "los recuerdos".

ParticuliÃ¨rement fier de sa "punchline", le chroniqueur Jeremstar la rÃ©itÃ¨re Ã  plusieurs reprises dans son nouveau livre et dans les mÃ©dias: "Aujourd'hui, quand on a fait des Ã©tudes et qu'on a un bagage culturel, on est forcÃ©ment une erreur de casting dans ce milieu. En gÃ©nÃ©ral, les candidats intelligents ne perdurent pas dans la tÃ©lÃ©rÃ©alitÃ©. Ils sont rapidement Ã©jectÃ©s par les productions puisque, forcÃ©ment, ils ne sont pas manipulables".

Je me demande quel intÃ©rÃªt ils peuvent trouver Ã  voir d'autres jeunes gens se manipuler, se harceler, voire se dÃ©molir les uns les autres, dans le seul but de faire de l'audience. Selon une rÃ©cente Ã©tude, 42% des adolescents de 13 Ã  17 ans disent suivre assidÃ»ment ces programmes, et parmi eux 80% de filles. Si certain(e)s sont capables de second degrÃ© et de faire la part des choses entre leurs Ã©tudes et la tÃ©lÃ©vision, jugÃ©e relaxante, c'est loin d'Ãªtre le cas de tou(te)s. Et que dire des enfants? DÃ¨s 8 ou 9 ans, ils sont nombreux Ã  regarder ces sÃ©ances de pugilat filmÃ©es en toute bonne conscience par des productions plus intÃ©ressÃ©es par l'argent que par l'Ã©ducation. Culture et audimat deviendraient-ils antinomiques? Si c'est le cas, alors notre jeunesse est en grand danger!

J'ai voulu comprendre comment Ã©taient construits les "modÃ¨les" que cette tÃ©lÃ©vision propose Ã  nos enfants. DÃ¨s le casting, trois critÃ¨res sont donc mis en avant: la beautÃ© physique, les personnalitÃ©s fortes et sanguines â€“voire Ã  tendance destructriceâ€“ et le cÃ©libat, pour Ã©viter les attaches personnelles qui nuiraient Ã  leur immersion totale dans ce monde factice et pour encourager les histoires de cÅ“ur entre les candidats.

Ceux qui sont sÃ©lectionnÃ©s savent que, pour rester Ã  l'antenne, et pour atteindre cette cÃ©lÃ©britÃ© qui les fait tant rÃªver, ils doivent gÃ©nÃ©rer des coups d'Ã©clats.

Ceux qui sont sÃ©lectionnÃ©s savent que, pour rester Ã  l'antenne, et pour atteindre cette cÃ©lÃ©britÃ© qui les fait tant rÃªver, ils doivent gÃ©nÃ©rer des coups d'Ã©clats. C'est ainsi que se crÃ©ent des clans, sous-tendus par des alliances et des trahisons successives, oÃ¹ chaque individu rÃ©vÃ¨le sa jalousie, sa mÃ©chancetÃ© et tous ses pires penchants jusqu'Ã  la folie, tout Ã§a pour faire le buzz, quand ce n'est pas sa bÃªtise qui est accentuÃ©e par une phrase dite "culte", Ã  l'instar du "Nan, mais allÃ´, quoi!", rÃ©plique reprise Ã  toutes les sauces dans les cours de rÃ©crÃ©ation. On est loin des phrases qui ont pu inspirer les gÃ©nÃ©rations prÃ©cÃ©dentes, comme "I have a dream" ou "Je vous ai compris", dont la rÃ©fÃ©rence n'Ã©voque plus rien pour la plupart des adolescents.

Mais que sous-entendent ces actes dÃ©mesurÃ©s? Si une grande partie de ce qui est filmÃ© est sur-jouÃ©, voire scÃ©narisÃ©, que reste-t-il de franchise et qui sont rÃ©ellement ces candidats placÃ©s sous les projecteurs?

Une conversation avec l'un de leurs agents suffit pour comprendre de quelle violence et de quelle souffrance morale ils sont victimes. Boulimie, toxicomanie, pulsions suicidaires ou criminelles, voilÃ  leur face cachÃ©e, si savamment Ã©touffÃ©e Ã  l'Ã©cran. VoilÃ  ce que devraient savoir les jeunes qui suivent leurs petites histoires et voudraient leur ressembler: non, il ne suffit pas d'Ãªtre jeune, beau, mÃ©chant et de dire des bÃªtises Ã  la tÃ©lÃ©vision pour Ãªtre heureux et riche. Surtout pas riche, quand on sait que certaines productions comme La Grosse Ã‰quipe ne payent leurs candidats que plusieurs mois aprÃ¨s la fin du programme! Ces jeunes gens se retrouvent ainsi obligÃ©s de se tourner vers la publicitÃ©, n'importe quelle publicitÃ©, simplement pour payer leurs factures!

Une conversation avec l'un de leurs agents suffit pour comprendre de quelle souffrance morale ils sont victimes. Boulimie, toxicomanie, pulsions suicidaires ou criminelles, voilÃ  la face cachÃ©e des candidats, si savamment Ã©touffÃ©e Ã  l'Ã©cran.

La plupart auraient cruellement besoin d'un suivi psychologique, que les maisons de production ne leur offrent pas ou mal. Au lieu de cela, ils les enferment dans un cercle vicieux qui les dÃ©valorise toujours plus, mais les rend toujours plus bankable.

Une nouvelle tendance a dÃ©rivÃ© de cette faÃ§on de considÃ©rer ces candidats uniquement comme des mannes financiÃ¨res, et qui se rÃ©vÃ¨le diaboliquement perverse pour leurs fans: le placement de produits sur les rÃ©seaux sociaux. Jusqu'en 2015, ces stars Ã©taient employÃ©es par les marques pour publier des photos sur leurs comptes Snapchat ou Instagram, et pour faire des happenings dans des centres commerciaux ou des lieux publics: Ã  cette Ã©poque-lÃ , ils Ã©taient encore relativement accessibles et chaque fan pouvait obtenir gratuitement une photo ou un autographe. Mais depuis 2015 et l'apparition dans le systÃ¨me des "apporteurs d'affaires", dont l'entreprise Shauna Event's reprÃ©sente Ã  elle seule 80 Ã  90% des parts de marchÃ© et dont le rÃ©gime juridique et fiscal suscite quelques interrogations, c'est leur image tout entiÃ¨re â€“et donc leur vie et leur libertÃ©â€“ qui est contrÃ´lÃ©e par les marques et le merchandising.

Les candidats signent un contrat avec leur apporteur d'affaires, qui les met en relation avec des marques. En Ã©change d'une somme d'argent par clichÃ© â€“entre 500 et 1500â‚¬, selon la marque, parfois plus d'aprÃ¨s certaines sourcesâ€“, ils doivent publier des photos sur leurs diffÃ©rents comptes et inviter leurs fans Ã  acheter les produits vantÃ©s en les faisant profiter d'un code promotionnel.

Tant qu'il s'agissait de vÃªtements, de bijoux ou de maquillage, cela ne faisait du tort qu'au porte-monnaie. Mais la machine s'est emballÃ©e, et dÃ©sormais, coupe-faim, produits blanchissants pour les dents, boissons protÃ©inÃ©es, thÃ© dÃ©tox interdits aux moins de 16 ans, ou encore complÃ©ments alimentaires et mÃªme paris sportifs interdits aux moins de 18 ans, deviennent les must have de tout fan qui se respecte, et mÃªme des autres, car il devient impossible dans certains lycÃ©es de ne pas prendre parti pour tel ou tel candidat, et de ne pas cÃ©der Ã  la tentation de ces produits, pour la plupart contre-indiquÃ©s chez des sujets si jeunes â€“mais quel jeune prend connaissance des contre-indications quand il s'agit d'Ãªtre Ã  la mode?

Les parents s'insurgent, Ã  juste titre, mais contre qui se retourner? Candidats, marques, intermÃ©diaires, productions, personne n'est apparemment responsable! Et ceux qui le sont rÃ©ellement se cachent derriÃ¨re leurs conseillers juridiques, si bien qu'il est impossible aux parents comme aux professeurs, Ã©galement dÃ©bordÃ©s, d'intenter une action collective.

En outre, ne peut-on Ã©tablir un lien entre l'avÃ¨nement de ce type de publicitÃ© et la hausse du harcÃ¨lement scolaire? Quand le culte de la beautÃ© plastique est encore une fois assÃ©nÃ© Ã  ces jeunes en pleine transformation physique, et quand tout devient une affaire de richesse et d'apparence, que chacun est Ã©valuÃ© Ã  l'aune de ce qu'il possÃ¨de et de sa proximitÃ© avec des personnages en grande partie fictifs, dont l'exemple les autorise Ã  perpÃ©trer les coups les plus bas, quels sont ceux qui trinquent en premier, Ã  votre avis?

Ne peut-on Ã©tablir un lien entre l'avÃ¨nement de ce type de publicitÃ© et la hausse du harcÃ¨lement scolaire?

Je ne juge pas ici les candidats de ces Ã©missions, qui sont autant victimes que les jeunes qui les regardent: alors que la majoritÃ© d'entre eux adoreraient dialoguer avec leurs fans, les apporteurs d'affaires les contraignent en effet Ã  monnayer photos et autographes, Ã  ne pas rÃ©pondre Ã  qui que ce soit sans le faire payer au prÃ©alable, et leur interdisent de faire du bÃ©nÃ©volat auprÃ¨s d'associations caritatives qui pourraient bÃ©nÃ©ficier de leur image. Ils les gardent prisonniers de leur contrat "tout pour l'argent", et leur ferment ainsi presque toutes les portes sur le plan professionnel; comment s'Ã©tonner ensuite que beaucoup d'entre eux en viennent Ã  se dÃ©tester â€“et fort heureusement pour quelques uns, Ã  se rÃ©volter?

En revanche, je pose la question des responsabilitÃ©s. En tant que mÃ¨re, il est de mon devoir de protÃ©ger mes enfants, et des mauvaises influences de la tÃ©lÃ©vision, et des mauvais traitements Ã  l'Ã©cole. Mais quels outils sont donnÃ©s aux parents pour recadrer leur enfant, notamment Ã  ceux qui n'ont pas les moyens de le faire accÃ©der Ã  plus de vie sociale et culturelle? N'y aurait-il pas un travail d'information et d'Ã©ducation Ã  mener lÃ -dessus?

DÃ¨s qu'un jeune a accÃ¨s Ã  la culture et Ã  une vie sociale riche et Ã©quilibrÃ©e, il se dÃ©sintÃ©resse de ce type de tÃ©lÃ©vision, qu'il qualifie de "dÃ©bile et abrutissante". Comment pouvons-nous, nous adultes, agir pour que la jeunesse se dÃ©tourne, partiellement ou totalement, de ces programmes et de ce star system perverti afin que les chaÃ®nes de tÃ©lÃ©vision envisagent enfin de revoir leurs grilles et de dÃ©velopper des Ã©missions plus constructives, Ã  la fois intellectuellement et humainement?

DÃ¨s qu'un jeune a accÃ¨s Ã  la culture et Ã  une vie sociale riche et Ã©quilibrÃ©e, il se dÃ©sintÃ©resse de ce type de tÃ©lÃ©vision, qu'il qualifie de "dÃ©bile et abrutissante".

Les vrais responsables de ce dÃ©sastre sont ceux dont la logique Ã©conomique prÃ©vaut sur la logique morale et humaine, malheureusement la lÃ©gislation actuelle comporte suffisamment de failles pour qu'ils puissent se protÃ©ger de toute attaque. Il en va donc de notre responsabilitÃ© Ã  tous, parents et Ã©ducateurs â€“scolaires, pÃ©riscolaires et mÃªme extrascolairesâ€“ et surtout personnel politique, de trouver des solutions pour nos jeunes, de dialoguer avec eux, de leur montrer que les apparences sont parfois trompeuses, de leur rÃ©apprendre Ã  vivre ensemble en bonne intelligence et non sous un rÃ©gime de peur et d'affrontements constants. Ma mission en tant que nouvelle DÃ©lÃ©guÃ©e SpÃ©ciale Ã  l'Ã‰ducation Artistique et Culturelle dans les LycÃ©es et celle, je l'espÃ¨re, que vous m'aiderez Ã  concrÃ©tiser, ira dans ce sens: il s'agira de faire un Ã©tat des lieux des actions culturelles dans les Ã©tablissements afin de permettre une meilleure intÃ©gration de l'Ã©ducation culturelle et artistique dans la vie des lycÃ©es et donc de mettre en place des programmes et des activitÃ©s permettant aux jeunes de s'ouvrir l'esprit, de discuter et de dÃ©velopper leur esprit critique afin de devenir des citoyens Ã©clairÃ©s, capables de diversifier leurs sources d'informations et d'apprÃ©hender la rÃ©alitÃ© dans ses aspects multiples et souvent complexes.

Tout ceci est Ã  notre portÃ©e et je sais que de nombreux candidats seraient prÃªts Ã  prendre le risque de se dresser contre ce systÃ¨me, d'apparaÃ®tre tels qu'ils sont rÃ©ellement, avec leurs blessures et leur expÃ©rience de ce milieu, afin de participer aux dispositifs culturels offerts par les lycÃ©es. DÃ©velopper ou renouveler ces dispositifs afin d'estomper les inÃ©galitÃ©s territoriales et rÃ©duire l'impact de telles Ã©missions est primordial, car les jeunes d'aujourd'hui seront la France de demain, et tous mÃ©ritent qu'on leur Ã©pargne ce genre de sous-culture, qu'on leur donne accÃ¨s au meilleur de la connaissance, et que chacun puisse avoir l'occasion de dÃ©velopper son potentiel et son originalitÃ© grÃ¢ce Ã  une profonde action culturelle, lisible et coordonnÃ©e.

SUMMARY:
And in a world where we really should just embrace differences and celebrate them, that's a beautiful thing.
The world literally revolves around the media, the internet and social media and it's naivie to think that the only way to create change is to shout in the streets.
Trans activist and founder of Nail TransphobiaNine Everyday Products You Never Knew Were Made By Slaves Slavery still exists.
Most of us are unwittingly loading products into our shopping trolleys that have been produced by people in slavery.
Communications Director at anti-slavery organisation International Justice Mission UKIt's Time For Everyone To See Themselves Represented, Both Onstage And Off.
TEXT:
The Big Little Sister To Syd, Brody is Brody. She accepts him for who is he - her brother. And in a world where we really should just embrace differences and celebrate them, that's a beautiful thing. Because sadly this isn't always the case. Mother. Blogger. Campaigner

Embracing The Press And Social Media Doesn't Make Me Any Less Of A 'Proper' Activist It's stupid to think that using press or social media as a tool for your activism makes you any less of a 'proper' activist, it's 2017 sweetie, this is the world we live in. The world literally revolves around the media, the internet and social media and it's naivie to think that the only way to create change is to shout in the streets. Trans activist and founder of Nail Transphobia

Nine Everyday Products You Never Knew Were Made By Slaves Slavery still exists. In fact, there are more people in slavery today than at any other point in history. And it's not a distant problem that doesn't affect us. Most of us are unwittingly loading products into our shopping trolleys that have been produced by people in slavery. Communications Director at anti-slavery organisation International Justice Mission UK

It's Time For Everyone To See Themselves Represented, Both Onstage And Off. Loud, Proud And Full Of Joy. It's my firm belief that celebrating and promoting those identified as having learning disabilities impacts positively on society as a whole. It's about celebrating difference and the many different ways of being successful and valuable. Playwright and performer with an interest in new perspectives, new narratives, contemporary drama and feminism.

My Life As A Midwife On A Rescue Ship During The Mediterranean Migrant Crisis Alice Gautreau is a midwife working with Medecins Sans Frontieres. In this exclusive vlog for HuffPost UK, Alice talks about her life-saving work on board the Aquarius refugee rescue vessel in the Mediterranean, and the incredible story of helping a woman give birth on board the ship. Medecins sans Frontiere midwife

Making Peace With My Hearing Loss "You have something in your ear," a small voice piped up from behind me at the playground. I heard the voice, but wasn't sure she was talking to me. "Excuse me," she repeated with some alarm, "do you know you have something in your ear?" She was pointing at my ears with surprise. Hearing health advocate, writer, LivingWithHearingLoss.com

Being A Daddy And Campaigning For Shared Parental Leave With our second baby on the way we looked closely, and very excitedly, at the shared parental leave situation, and set about doing our sums. Maybe I could take four months, and my partner take five, and we overlap in the middle? Maybe we could both be off for a chunk of time and make it work? Nope. Campaigner for shared parental leave. Arts professional. Father to Jack.

Prevention Rather Than Cure. Part One... Last week was my favourite week of the year people...no not Christmas. Guess again?! No, not international David Gandy appreciation week....It was National Eye Health Week! Finally, we get a week to preach about looking after your eyes so you don't end up with squiffy ones like mine. Comedian and writer.

What To Expect When You Are (Not) Expecting A Child With Cerebral Palsy William needs 24/7 care, but he loves being with people, whether they are children or 'grown-ups'. If you're (not) expecting a child with cerebral palsy you won't be expecting the feelings of relief, comfort and happiness when you see them build relationships with adults who want to help them as much as you do. Writer & Disability Campaigner

Life In A Wheelchair - The Questions You Always Wanted To Ask Naturally as a newly injured child, my thoughts didn't turn to mortgages or whether I would be able to get a job. At that time, I had no concept of just how expensive having a spinal cord injury could be. I had far more pressing concerns such as: Head of Bolt Burdon Kemp's spinal injury department

After The Tsunami Hit Thailand In 2004 I Couldn't Leave Those In Need Behind Every evening I taught art to the children on the camp, their drawings were harrowing and therapeutic at the same time. Their pictures initially were of bodies in water and people stuck up trees but soon evolved into happier scenes of elephants rescuing people, and families in their tents smiling. Founder of Acorn Overseas

Yes, I Take Full Responsibility For This Disease I Can't Control... It has crossed my mind many times that it would be much easier to just not tell people I have epilepsy. But there is always that chance of a seizure, and the risk of something going wrong - or someone doing something wrong - is reduced if we all talk about epilepsy a little bit more and encourage people with epilepsy to do more. If I've decided I can take the risk, you can too. Writer with a tongue-testing name. Condensing the world into frantic words.

Are Disabled Young People Being Set Up To Fail? The political party conference season is getting in full swing. Housing, the NHS, social care as well as Brexit are among issues prominent on the agendas at these annual political melting pots. But there's another one which deserves a higher level of attention and that impacts on hundreds of thousands of lives every day in the UK. CEO of Leonard Cheshire Disability. Previously managing director at RNIB Solutions. He is also a co-founder and trustee of Blind in Business.

People Think It's Extraordinary That I Work - But Disability Doesn't Have To Be A Barrier When I graduated from university in 2015, I was under the illusion that with a good degree and a strong CV due to all the volunteering that I'd done, I would find a job pretty quickly. This couldn't have been further from the truth. supporter Scope and Virgin Mediaâ€™s Work With Me campaign

Why Mexico Is Proof Anti-Abortion Laws Don't Work Since January, following President Trump's reintroduction of the Mexico City Policy (an Executive order that withholds American aid from health organisations that provide or even discuss abortion), that hostility has spiked, with abusive tweets filling our social media feeds. This vitriol directed at Mexican women is infuriating on so many levels and inaccurate on at least three. But while the temptation is either to howl in rage or dismiss it as 'just another tweet', these digital outbursts are symptomatic of the misinformation that persists around abortion and the stigmatisation of women who choose to end a pregnancy. Country director for Marie Stopes Mexico
TITLE: Impact

Wenn man sich nun vorstellt, oder gar davon Kenntnis hat, dass so viele Gruppen weltweit - ob Studentenverbindungen, Kirchen, Sekten, politische Parteien, FÃ¼hrungs-, Vorstandsetagen und Gremien, was auch immer, gerade wenn es an die Nachwuchsgenerierung geht - davon leben Gemeinsames zu erleben, gemeinsam etwas durchzustehen, aber auch gemeinsam Ã¼ber rote Linien zu gehen, einander gemeinsam und wechselseitig zu drÃ¤ngen, zu nÃ¶tigen die eigenen Grenzen zu Ã¼berschreiten, sich Ritualen zu unterwerfen, die nicht nur jenseits des guten Geschmacks sind, sondern die insbesondere darauf abzielen Ã¼ber alle Grenzen zu gehen, auch und gerade wenn jene Praktiken und Mutproben im klaren Widerspruch zur MenschenwÃ¼rde stehen - in Studentenverbindungen etwa lÃ¤uft dies unter dem Begriff "Hazing" - dann wird eines daran deutlich: Dieses Vorgehen macht die Gruppe regelrecht aus, ist es doch aus Sicht der Gruppen geradezu fÃ¼r den Zusammenhalt notwendig, dass die Mitglieder gemeinsam diese Erfahrungen machen, gemeinsam Peinlichkeiten durchleben, DemÃ¼tigungen ertragen, Ã¼ber das gemeinsam als schockierend Erlebte schweigen und sich Ã¼ber das Schweigen in Komplizenschaft begeben, fortan gemeinsame Geheimnisse teilen, diese hÃ¼ten, weil man von einander in pikanten Situationen weiÃŸ, um einander und ein Leben lang in der Hand zu haben, auch und gerade wenn es um die Nachwuchsgenerierung der Elite geht, die von Schwulenclubs zu Bordellen wandert - hin und wieder zurÃ¼ck - wenn sie nicht gerade mit demÃ¼tigenden Aufnahmeritualen beschÃ¤ftigt ist, deren Details ich Ihnen nun ersparen mÃ¶chte, sind jene Hazing-Praktiken doch auch von Elite-UniversitÃ¤ten hinlÃ¤nglich bekannt sind.

Denn die gemeinsam durchlebte Grenzerfahrung, das hemmungslose Ãœberschreiten von Tabus und Menschlichkeit, verbunden mit dem oft lebenslang gefÃ¼hlten schlechten Gewissen der daran Beteiligten - sofern sie nur dabei waren und nicht federfÃ¼hrend - wegen der gemeinsam ertragenen, verÃ¼bten und getragenen Schandtaten, genÃ¼gt in den meisten FÃ¤llen schon vÃ¶llig, um einander aktiv oder passiv lebenslÃ¤nglich unter Druck zu setzen und am betreten-gebÃ¼ckten Gang jene zu erkennen, die dabei waren.

Da braucht es gar keine Dokumentation dessen, was begangen wurde, was alles in unserer ach so entwickelten Ersten Welt hinter den Kulissen vor sich geht, wenn die Ã–ffentlichkeit gerade nicht hinschaut, was sich in einer "Elite" abspielt, die lÃ¤ngst schon und vielleicht immer schon, nichts mit Elite - den AuserwÃ¤hlten, den Lichtgestalten - zu tun hatte, sondern bloÃŸ Establishment war und ist und diese beschriebenen hinter den Kulissen betriebenen Methoden fÃ¼r normal hÃ¤lt, als "Part of the Game", und letztlich als gÃ¤ngige Praxis der Teambildung, des ZusammenschweiÃŸens von Menschen zu gut funktionierenden Gruppen versteht, erlebt und allen verordnet, die nicht standhaft bleiben. Und denen, die es vermÃ¶gen sich dem Druck und Gruppenzwang zu widersetzen, weil sie diese Praktiken mehr als seltsam erleben, wird der Ausgang gewiesen, die TÃ¼r gezeigt.

Sind sie doch fÃ¼r alles zu haben und - man kÃ¶nnte sagen - fÃ¼r nichts zu gebrauchen. Doch das wÃ¤re zu einfach, viel zu einfach. Denn jene Menschen, die das alles mitmachen und mittragen, sind fÃ¼r alles zu haben und fÃ¼r alles zu missbrauchen.

Dr. Dr. Immanuel Fruhmann

SUMMARY:
The lack of fear of rape, in this situation, exemplifies the different experience I have as a man, compared to a woman.
We men need to listen, we need to accept culpability and we need to stop ignoring the things that women tell us about their experiences.
I'm trying, I'm trying, I'm trying and I'm trying to try harder.
If we all work at it, together, maybe we can make life a little bit easier, maybe, for everyone.
But I didn't want to stay silent, because I want to let women know that they are being listened to, they are being heard.
TEXT:
Over seven years ago at about 2am, on a warm September night, I was violently mugged.

On a residential street in Islington, North London, I was jumped from behind and thrown to the ground, punched in the head into the pavement, ordered to empty my pockets and told that if I made any noise I'd be stabbed. The whole event lasted probably less than 15 seconds and as scary and horrible as it was, it's only in the last year or so - while trying very, very, very hard to understand the world better - that I have realised something that was absent from my thoughts while the attack happened and in the many years afterwards that I spent worrying about it happening again. I was never, not at any point, ever, worried about being sexually assaulted by my attackers, both the real ones and later imaginary ones. This, I have come to understand during my intense and relentless reeducation over the last year, is the most extreme example in my life of my male privilege.

The lack of fear of rape, in this situation, exemplifies the different experience I have as a man, compared to a woman. While I was being mugged, with no other people in sight, two strong, young, men had me on the ground in the middle of the night and I didn't worry about, didn't have to worry about, sexual assault.

As a man, I take things like this - this lack of fear - for granted. My muggers wanted my money and my phone and that was it, and I knew that if I gave these things to them they'd let me go, and they did. It isn't fair that most women have to worry more than I do. And the reason why they have to is because - as indicated by the last weeks' posts - ALL women experience, at some point, sexual threat. Men: we need to change the way we behave.

Maybe this sounds like a big ask, but that's because it is. It might be difficult, it might lose us friends and it might make us feel uncomfortable, embarrassed or ashamed due to our past behaviour (none of us are completely innocent, are we, let's be honest), but if we - as people, rather than as men - want to make the world a better place, we - as men and people - need to work at it, too.

We men need to listen, we need to accept culpability and we need to stop ignoring the things that women tell us about their experiences. I'm sorry if me speaking about this is being listened to more than the words of ANY woman who has been unfairly ignored. But I think my silence, on this topic, would be as good as me denying the existence of the hashtag that's been shared by pretty much every woman I know.

It's difficult to not be incredibly moved by these posts over the last few days, and the sheer ubiquity of this experience - and the secretive way in which multiple men have asked me if I'd realised how endemic sexual harassment towards women is - indicates the massive gulf between male and female experience.

I've been trying very hard and very consciously to be a good person for a while now, and it has come at quite a heavy personal cost, both psychologically and financially. I don't want to be part of the problem, but not being part of the problem - when you're a cisgender, [effectively] heterosexual, able-bodied white man with a university education and some nice clothes - is f*cking hard and requires energy and effort on a daily basis.

I'm continuing to pay attention to my actions and - crucially - my inactions. I will keep trying to be better, because I know it's the right thing to do and I know that anyone trying to stop me doing what I know is right should be ignored.

I'm trying, I'm trying, I'm trying and I'm trying to try harder.

Life isn't easy for many people, but it's easier for men, and that isn't fair. It also isn't fair that most energy to change this comes from women. If we all work at it, together, maybe we can make life a little bit easier, maybe, for everyone. Maybe I shouldn't be commenting on this, as a man. But I didn't want to stay silent, because I want to let women know that they are being listened to, they are being heard. I'm sorry.
TITLE: A Male Response To #MeToo (Probably A Few Days Late)

SUMMARY:
Cuando el amor estÃ¡ empezando, tenemos la sensaciÃ³n de que el mundo brilla mucho mÃ¡s.
El amor duradero sÃ­ que es posible , pero no lo es si esperas que el amor haga todo el trabajo por ti, y tampoco lo es si te niegas a comprender los lÃ­mites del amor.
El amor alimenta la generosidad, la pasiÃ³n y la belleza.
Queremos que el amor sea mÃ¡s de lo que es.
El amor es maravilloso, pero no lo es todo.
TEXT:
Historia original: Thought Catalog y Quote Catalog.

Por MÃ©lanie Berliet

Entiendo por quÃ© todo el mundo busca el amor. Por quÃ© invertimos tanto tiempo, energÃ­a, esfuerzo y dinero en ir de cita en cita y tratar de encontrar pareja. Por quÃ© soÃ±amos con el tÃ­pico "y fueron felices y comieron perdices".

Por quÃ© lloramos de emociÃ³n cuando un amigo nos anuncia que se va a casar y por quÃ© tambiÃ©n lo hacemos en casi todas las bodas. Por quÃ© nos encanta chismear sobre las rupturas y por quÃ© tendemos a estigmatizar el divorcio, como si romper fuera lo mÃ¡s trÃ¡gico que le puede suceder a una pareja.

Por quÃ© escondemos la realidad detrÃ¡s de la pareja y lo adornamos con hashtags proclamando lo orgullosos que estamos de nuestra media naranja.

El amor es una droga maravillosa. Puede ser espectacular encontrarlo y sucumbir a Ã©l: sumergirnos en su poder, tan enigmÃ¡tico, y que nos permite deleitarnos con el ideal de "esto es lo que andaba buscando". Sentir que finalmente has descubierto el secreto de la felicidad y que has encontrado el sentido a tu existencia con ese posible compaÃ±ero de vida.

Todos queremos una pareja: alguien en quien poder apoyarnos, alguien con quien poder ir a todas partes, alguien con quien desahogarnos, alguien con quien celebrar los Ã©xitos (sean grandes o pequeÃ±os), alguien con quien coger.

Pero el amor no te va a arreglar la vida.

No puede hacerlo. SÃ­ que puede mejorar las cosas, especialmente al principio, cuando encuentras a esa persona con la que crees que serÃ­as capaz de compartir toda tu vida. Cuando el amor estÃ¡ empezando, tenemos la sensaciÃ³n de que el mundo brilla mucho mÃ¡s. Cuando estÃ¡s enamorado de alguien, las cosas que solÃ­an resultarte aburridas ya no lo parecen tanto. Las actividades que de por sÃ­ eran agradables acaban siendo incluso mÃ¡s gratificantes.

El amor no transforma toda tu realidad. No te convierte en una persona distinta, ni resuelve todos tus problemas, ni borra tus errores.

Pero ese encaprichamiento no dura eternamente, ni siquiera para las personas mÃ¡s enamoradas del planeta. Esto ya lo sabemos y, sin embargo, siempre se nos olvida. El deseo acaba desvaneciÃ©ndose y, cuando lo hace, se ve reemplazado por la comodidad, las experiencias compartidas y muchos recuerdos memorables. A ello se le suman las peleas, los celos, las tentaciones, las dudas y el cansancio en la pareja.

El amor duradero sÃ­ que es posible , pero no lo es si esperas que el amor haga todo el trabajo por ti, y tampoco lo es si te niegas a comprender los lÃ­mites del amor.

El amor no transforma toda tu realidad. No te convierte en una persona distinta, ni resuelve todos tus problemas, ni borra tus errores. Lo que sÃ­ que hace es crear mÃ¡s problemas. El amor no siempre es bonito.

De hecho puede ser bastante feo. No es una tirita para curar la desesperaciÃ³n emocional. De hecho, puede causar estragos psicolÃ³gicos en muchos casos. No es un motivo por el que vivir. Es mÃ¡s, puede impulsar a algunas personas a matar. Los delitos de pasiÃ³n existen. El amor alimenta la generosidad, la pasiÃ³n y la belleza. Pero tambiÃ©n alimenta la maldad, la oscuridad e incluso el odio.

Todos queremos amor y todos lo merecemos. Pero no debes esperar que tu mundo cambie mÃ¡gicamente en cuanto lo encuentres.

Queremos que el amor sea mÃ¡s de lo que es. Queremos que sea esa fuerza trascendental que nos une como seres humanos, incluso cuando nos separa. Queremos que haga de la vida algo que merezca la pena vivir. Queremos que cure nuestro sufrimiento. Queremos que llene nuestra vida de significado. Pero la verdad es que todo eso debes hacerlo por ti mismo.

Todos queremos amor y todos lo merecemos. Pero no debes esperar que tu mundo cambie mÃ¡gicamente en cuanto lo encuentres. SÃ­, hay algunas cosas de la vida que inmediatamente parecen mucho mejores cuando has encontrado un cÃ³mplice. Pero el amor no siempre es la respuesta.

A menudo la respuesta es sencillamente trabajar duro. O la introspecciÃ³n y el crecimiento personal. A veces, la respuesta es decir adiÃ³s. Y, a veces, la respuesta es simplemente no.

La vida que llevas estÃ¡ determinada por la suma de decisiones que tomas. Algunas de estas decisiones estÃ¡n relacionadas con las personas que decides amar. Pero muchas otras no tienen ningÃºn tipo de relaciÃ³n con el amor.

No vivas por amor. Si esperas que te llene o presionas a las personas que amas a que te hagan sentir pleno, acabarÃ¡s completamente decepcionado y, probablemente, solo. El amor es maravilloso, pero no lo es todo. Las mejores historias de amor de la ficciÃ³n son completamente increÃ­bles. Las mejores canciones de amor estÃ¡n inspiradas en algo, pero son reduccionistas.

El amor no es todo lo que necesitas. Tienes otras necesidades y solo tÃº puedes asegurarte de que se vean satisfechas. AsÃ­ que mira dentro de ti mismo y trata de averiguar quÃ© es lo que quieres en tu vida. DespuÃ©s, invierte la misma cantidad de tiempo, energÃ­a, esfuerzo y recursos econÃ³micos necesarios para conseguir ese otro objetivo.

En cualquier caso, encuentra alguien a quien amar. Pero no olvides encontrarte a ti mismo tambiÃ©n.

Puedes seguir a MÃ©lanie en Instagram y Facebook.

Este artÃ­culo fue publicado originalmente en HuffPost Estados Unidos y ha sido traducido del inglÃ©s por MarÃ­a GinÃ©s Grao para El HuffPost.

*Este contenido representa la opiniÃ³n del autor y no necesariamente la de HuffPost MÃ©xico.
TITLE: El amor no es suficiente, no esperes que te arregle la vida

Â«Ce qu'on s'est dit, c'est que dÃ©placer quelqu'un en vÃ©lo, Ã§a coÃ»te moins cher Ã  la Ville que la voiture, le mÃ©tro ou l'autobus. Alors les investissements vont nous rapporterÂ», souligne-t-il.

Par ailleurs, M. Gadoury a prÃ©sentÃ© en fin de mandat un tout nouveau plan-cadre vÃ©lo pour la Ville. Ce plan prÃ©voit de maintenir la cadence de nouvelles pistes tout en amÃ©liorant les amÃ©nagements. La Ville privilÃ©giera ainsi les pistes surÃ©levÃ©es en site propre afin de limiter la compÃ©tition avec les automobilistes.

L'Ã©valuation finale de l'administration Coderre sera connue le 5 novembre, lors de l'annonce du gagnant des Ã©lections.

SUMMARY:
Gary Ablett is back at Geelong.
The Geelong club is indelibly linked to the Ablett clan.
But there's football family and family family, and it's family of the flesh-and-blood type which has undoubtedly been the strongest lure behind Ablett's return.
Ablett intimated as much in an open letter to the game of AFL which he penned for the website exclusiveinsight.com.
Gary Ablett Jnr + Patrick Dangerfield + Joel Selwood19x All-Australian12x B&F6x AFLPA MVP5x Flags4x AFLCA POY3x Brownlow (580 votes) â€” Joshua Kay (@js_kay) 19 de outubro de 2017For now, the important thing is not how Gary Ablett plays footy in 2018, but how he supports his family.
TEXT:
Gary Ablett is back at Geelong. The deal was done on the final day of the AFL trade Period, so after seven years up north with Gold Coast Suns, the 33-year-old dual Brownlow Medallist and two-time premiership winner will play again in the famous blue-and-white hoops.

Ablett's father Gary Snr was of course a club legend. The Geelong club is indelibly linked to the Ablett clan. But there's football family and family family, and it's family of the flesh-and-blood type which has undoubtedly been the strongest lure behind Ablett's return.

Ablett intimated as much in an open letter to the game of AFL which he penned for the website exclusiveinsight.com. He wrote:

"Sixteen years on [from the start of his career], now married and looking to start a family, my priorities have shifted. I need to be around my family back home, who I have spent the last 7 years doing long distance with. My sisters, my brother, and parents all play a huge role in my life, and it's time that I make myself more available to them and others back home. I am at a stage in my career where I need to get the balance right between footy and life outside of football, and the recent break period has allowed me the time that I needed to put certain things in place."

Tragically, in the brief period between that column and Thursday's announcement of his homecoming, Ablett's sister Natasha died from a suspected drug overdose. She had been receiving treatment through a Geelong area psychiatric unit.

I'd like to thank both the GC Suns and the GFC for their support this week and for getting me back home. Head to @exinsight for more info pic.twitter.com/TKAa7EIV6P â€” Gary Ablett Jnr (@GaryAblettJnr) 19 de outubro de 2017

While Ablett now starts a new phase of his personal life, fans hope he gets a new lease on life onfield too, and sparks Geelong to step up from premiership contenders to premiership winners.

Geelong won three flags between 2007 and 2011, and have remained an AFL powerhouse. But they've fallen one game short of the Grand Final for the past two seasons despite the acquisition of superstar Patrick Dangerfield.

With Dangerfield, captain Joel Selwood and Ablett in the midfield, fans have already begun to drool.

Gary Ablett Jnr + Patrick Dangerfield + Joel Selwood



19x All-Australian

12x B&F

6x AFLPA MVP

5x Flags

4x AFLCA POY

3x Brownlow (580 votes) â€” Joshua Kay (@js_kay) 19 de outubro de 2017

For now, the important thing is not how Gary Ablett plays footy in 2018, but how he supports his family.

"This week has been an emotional roller coaster, however, hearing that I will be returning home has brought both myself and my family some joy during what has been a difficult and painful time," he wrote in another column this week before the trade had officially gone through.

All fans and indeed all Australians wish him well.

If you need help in a crisis, call Lifeline on 13 11 14. For further information about depression contact beyondblue on 1300224636 or talk to your GP, local health professional or someone you trust.
TITLE: Gary Ablett Is A Geelong Cat Again After Tragic Death of Sister

Writer and mental health advocateGrenfell Tower Reveals It's Really The Middle-Class Who're Guilty Of The Politics Of Envy The residents of South Kensington complaining about rehousing Grenfell Tower victims in their neighbourhood need a reality check.
The Conservatives juggle negotiations for Brexit with negotiations for forming an actual government, and the terrible disaster at Grenfell Tower brings further challenges.
TEXT:
The Grenfell Inquiry Must Leave No Stone Unturned The Fire Brigades Union wants the Grenfell Inquiry to succeed, but the early signs are not promising. The inquiry will not investigate whether fire services are properly resourced. It won't consider government policy on social housing. General Secretary of the Fire Brigades Union

Andy Burnham's First 100 Days A politician can issue as many mission statements as they like. They can write a comprehensive manifesto that sets out a plan of action. And they can make as many promises as they think they can keep. But ultimately, as history shows time and time again, the true measure of their success, their effectiveness and their authority comes from how they react to the unforeseen. Events, dear boy, as Harold Macmillan put it. So it has proved with Andy Burnham's first 100 days as Greater Manchester's first directly elected metro Mayor. Works in external affairs at Manchester Metropolitan University. Suffers an excess of civic pride. Arte et Labore.

Grenfell Inquiry Terms Of Reference - A Bitter Disappointment The social, economic and political matters that formed the backdrop to this horrific event cannot be ignored or written out of the story. To do so would be to exacerbate the crime against the victims. General Secretary of the Fire Brigades Union

The Grenfell Inquiry Must Say That Everyone - Whatever Their Background - Has The Right To Life For this inquiry to serve its purpose and to attract our confidence, it must listen to what we say. The terms of references have been the talk of the community for weeks. It is important to us. A group of residents, race equality organisations, academics, lawyers and experts have put in a submission to the panel and may ask to become core participants. Our community is bruised, confidence in public authorities is at its lowest and we cannot cope with any further disappointment, any further rejection. We want our views to be taken into account for a change. Chair of Bramley House Residentsâ€™ Association

Civic Engagement Should Be A Part Of Our Daily Lives The last few weeks have been emotionally trying for all of us. With tensions running high ahead of the General Election, we had to come to terms with ... Chief Executive of City Year UK

What Grenfell Teaches Us About Over-Complexity There are so many lessons to be learned from the horrific events at Grenfell Tower and we will be digesting them for some years to come. One of the t... CEO of the charity think tank and consultancy New Philanthropy Capital, and Former Treasury and 10 Downing Street adviser

Grenfell Tower: Still Burning With Anger I just hope that the survivors and the relatives and friends of all those who died - and we will probably never know for sure exactly how many perished - will not have to wait 28 years for justice to be done, as have the families affected by the Hillsborough stadium disaster of 1989. Journalist and broadcaster

The Hillsborough Prosecutions Are A Victory For Our Grassroots Campaign Twenty eight years is a long time to sustain a fight for justice. It is also extremely difficult when you have to endure the antagonism and hostility of the establishment and mainstream media. The entire Hillsborough experience to date has been one long learning curve for many in respect of developing strategies for navigating a path for truth. It is fair to say that some were better at it than others. Researcher, Hillsborough Justice Campaign

How Writers Can Respond To And Help With The Grenfell Tower Fire Tragedy For the past weeks I have been helping to organise this years' London Writers' Week as a benefit for the fund to help victims of the Grenfell Tower fire, supported by The Tabernacle, the theatre and arts venue located less than one mile from Grenfell Tower. Director, Art School, and first Course Leader, MA Dramatic Writing, Drama Centre London, Central Saint Martins

After A Crisis Like Grenfell, It's Community Organisations That Hold Things Together Over the last few months we've had far too many unexpected shocks and tragic loss of life - the terror attacks in Westminster, Manchester, London Brid... Chief Executive of Locality, the national network supports local community organisations to build strong local communities

Grenfell - The Myths And Unsung Heros Of Estate Communities The Grenfell tragedy shows us what happens when we refuse to listen to people, rendering them powerless. We know the residents shared their concerns o... Writer, Art Director, Photographer.

Why You Need To Check Out Authors For Grenfell Tower With so much up for grabs from the likes of Matt Haig, Holly Bourne, Malorie Blackman and other renowned writers, college application counselling, coaching sessions, original manuscripts, mentoring and more, this is a great opportunity to meet or receive something from one of your favourite writers whilst supporting an honourable cause in the process. Writer and mental health advocate

Grenfell Tower Reveals It's Really The Middle-Class Who're Guilty Of The Politics Of Envy The residents of South Kensington complaining about rehousing Grenfell Tower victims in their neighbourhood need a reality check. Be grateful that nothing like this has happened to you. Not just the fire, but the sheer poverty that comes with living on a council estate. Instead of moaning that these people are getting help you've never needed, try being grateful for the fact that you have, in fact, never needed that help. Contributing Editor, The Gay UK Magazine

After Grenfell, Tenants Must Take Control Of Their Housing The most uncomfortable truth lurking within this tragedy is that there is a stigma attached to people who live in social housing. Narrowly, this means that a discount is applied to their views when they are expressed to the relevant authorities. Broadly it also means that the lives and wellbeing of people who live in council blocks are seen as having less value than home owners. Director of Policy and Advocacy at the New Economics Foundation

Time To Wake Up The Sleeping Sector? Nearly two weeks on, and the dust has still not settled after this rather extraordinary snap election. The Conservatives juggle negotiations for Brexit with negotiations for forming an actual government, and the terrible disaster at Grenfell Tower brings further challenges. CEO of the charity think tank and consultancy New Philanthropy Capital, and Former Treasury and 10 Downing Street adviser
TITLE: London Grenfell Tower Fire 2017

TEXT:
Schools should be rewarding effort not ability, an education journalist has urged after revealing pupils at one secondary school had been given â€œmore ableâ€ badges.

Cathy Murray, from London, tweeted a photo of a schoolchildâ€™s badge that read â€œmore ableâ€ on 17 October.

The features editor at Schools Week, explained that a Year 8 pupil she knew had shown her they had received the badge at school as a reward.

â€œThey were proud of the badge,â€ she told HuffPost UK. â€œThe pupils were given them out over several weeks gradually, with no explanation of what the badges meant.

â€œThe badges started appearing and so other students who didnâ€™t have them felt jealous and left out. So this teenager felt vindicated and enjoyed it.

â€œBut it wasnâ€™t clear to the student why they had the badge.â€

When Murray initially posted a photo of the badge on Twitter to gauge peopleâ€™s reaction, the response was unanimously negative.

A disgraceful tactic. Whoever set this up clearly has no idea about the psychological effect it's going to have on other students â€” Richard James Rogers (@richardjarogers) October 19, 2017

Thoughtless and divisive â€” Jane Goalen (@GoalenJane) October 18, 2017

noooooo. wrong on absolutley every level. â€” Lucy joy (@ljaxtell) October 17, 2017

Literally labelling students now! I do have faith and pride in our profession, and then some days I see things like this... *head in hands* â€” Thinking Out Loud (@HeadInTraining) October 18, 2017

Cringe - my toes are curling â€” Jen Edwards (@jenedwards72) October 17, 2017

Murray said itâ€™s rare when she asks for opinions on education issues on Twitter that people are unanimously on one side.

She decided to go to the school, who she has decided not to identify, as she does not want to â€œname and shameâ€ them.

â€œI asked for the reason why they decided to do this,â€ she explained. â€œI spoke with the school business manager who told me it was a mistake.

â€œIt was part of a leftover policy from a previous leadership team and it hadnâ€™t been a conscious decision by the current senior leadership team to give out the badges.

â€œThe headteacher said they did not support the policy. It had been a communication mistake and they were going to discuss how to retract the badges from students.â€

Murray was told some older students in Year 10 and Year 11, who had been handed the badges, had also complained about them to the school.

She said she had asked the school to keep her updated with their progress as she was interested to find out how they were going to retract the badges without leaving students feeling devalued or that they were â€œless ableâ€.

She also said when they do take the badges away, it is important that they have a discussion with students and make it a learning experience.

So is it possible to use badges to reward children in school, without making students feel undervalued?

Murray explained when she asked her Twitter followers this question, one suggested a good alternative would be a badge saying: â€œThereâ€™s no stopping meâ€, which she believed would work much better.

â€œIâ€™ve thought a lot about this since it has come up,â€ she added. â€œAbility is innate, so when you reward ability, it gives the message to students thatâ€™s damaging.

â€œIt raises the issue of when you pull students aside and call them â€˜gifted and talentedâ€™.

â€œI understand itâ€™s to motivate students, but we should be rewarding effort, not ability.
TITLE: Call For Kids To Be Rewarded On 'Effort Not Ability', After School Hands Out 'More Able' Badges

SUMMARY:
Sebetja Matsaung has been axed as Eskom's evidence leader in the disciplinary hearing of the utility's suspended executive Matshela Koko.
According to Fin24, Matsaung's services were terminated following an altercation between him and Financial Mail's Deputy Editor Sikonathi Mantshantsha.
"Eskom condemns Matsaung's behaviour in the strongest terms possible.
We wish to convey our unreserved apologies that this unfortunate incident occurred," Eskom said in a statement.
The hearing will now be postponed until a new evidence leader is appointed.
TEXT:
Sebetja Matsaung has been axed as Eskom's evidence leader in the disciplinary hearing of the utility's suspended executive Matshela Koko.

According to Fin24, Matsaung's services were terminated following an altercation between him and Financial Mail's Deputy Editor Sikonathi Mantshantsha.

"Eskom condemns Matsaung's behaviour in the strongest terms possible. We wish to convey our unreserved apologies that this unfortunate incident occurred," Eskom said in a statement.

The hearing will now be postponed until a new evidence leader is appointed.
TITLE: Evidence Leader For Former Matsela Koko Case Axed

TEXT:
Pierre Crom via Getty Images

Donezk und Lugansk sind aktuell fÃ¼r Journalisten fast unerreichbar.



Die Separatistengebiete einschlieÃŸlich vieler Ortschaften in der Kampfzone werden von der internationalen, aber auch der Berichterstattung in der Ukraine selbst weitgehend abgekoppelt. Dies wurde bei einer Medienkonferenz des Journalistennetzwerkes n-Ost vergangene Woche in Kiew bekannt.

Unter dem Thema â€Im Inneren vom blinden Fleck - Ã¼ber was wir berichten und was wir nicht sehen" hatten sich drei Tage lang Journalisten und Medienfachleute aus ganz Europa mit dem Thema Ukraine beschÃ¤ftigt.

Wie Oksana Grytsenko von der Kyiv Post informierte, war es zu Beginn des Konflikts vor rund drei Jahren zumindest fÃ¼r ukrainische Journalisten immer mÃ¶glich, zu beiden Seiten der Kampflinie zu kommen.

Nun aber sei das immer schwerer geworden. Nur manchmal gehe es noch im Rahmen von UN-Missionen. Gesicherte und Ã¼berprÃ¼fbare Informationen aus dem Kriegsgebiet gibt es deshalb kaum mehr mit Ausnahme der Beobachterberichte der OSCE-Mission, die tÃ¤glich auch fÃ¼r die Medien ein gutes Lagebild vermitteln.

Nikolaus von Twickel, der rund sechs Monate fÃ¼r die OSCE-Mission in der Ukraine arbeitete, berichtete, dass es im Moment fÃ¼r auslÃ¤ndische Journalisten so gut wie unmÃ¶glich ist nach Donezk zu kommen und in den Kriegsgebieten zu recherchieren.

Offizielle Voraussetzung dazu ist die Ausstellung der sogenannten ATO (Anti-Terrorist Operation Zone) Karte. Das gehe nur Ã¼ber das ukrainische Verteidigungsministerium sowie den ukrainischen Geheimdienst. Selbst mit Besitz der ATO-Karte bedeute das aber noch lange nicht, dass man die von den Truppen der Separatisten kontrollierten Checkpoints passieren dÃ¼rfe.

Die sogenannten 'BehÃ¶rden' der selbsternannten "Donzeker Volksrepublik (DNR)" hatten dem Kiewer Korrespondenten der Deutschen Welle die Einreise verweigert, obwohl er von Kiew aus alle notwendigen Dokumente organisierte. DafÃ¼r bieten die DNR-Propagandisten westlichen Sendern, die selber keinen Zugang nach Donezk bekommen, Filmmaterial an. Insgesamt sind in Kiew noch zwÃ¶lf internationale Korrespondenten tÃ¤tig. Zum Vergleich: in Moskau arbeiten Ã¼ber 700.

Leben in Lugansk und Donezk verlÃ¤uft ruhig

In Lugansk selbst Ã¼berwiegt laut Gosha Tikhy, der gelegentlich fÃ¼r die ARD tÃ¤tig ist, aktuell die russische Propaganda bei der Erstellung von Meinungsbildern, wobei eine Journalistin wÃ¤hrend der Konferenz in Kiew auch sagte, dass jene Menschen, die in den Separatistengebieten leben bzw. dort geblieben sind, das aus Ãœberzeugung fÃ¼r die prorussische Sache tun.

Mit zunehmender Dauer der Existenz der Volksrepubliken Donezk und Lugansk gebe es dort inzwischen auch gezielte Einflussnahme auf Kinder, die im russischen Sinn patriotisch erzogen werden, wozu neben dem Erlernen der russischen Sprache auch vormilitÃ¤rische Ausbildung zÃ¤hlt. Auch Bestrebungen Schulen nach gefallenen KÃ¤mpfern zu benennen gehÃ¶re dazu.

Das Leben verlaufe persÃ¶nlich weitgehend normal, wenn man gegenÃ¼ber der Separatistenregierung loyal ist und sich politischer Meinungen in der Ã–ffentlichkeit enthÃ¤lt. Allerdings werde die Ã¶konomische Situation immer schlechter, was mit gestiegenen Preisen bei niedrig gebliebenen LÃ¶hnen zusammenhÃ¤ngt. Schmuggel von Waren aus der Ukraine blÃ¼ht.

Gleichzeitig kommen viele Rentner schlecht an ihre Pensionen, weil sie dazu aus den Separatistengebieten Ã¼ber die Checkpoints in die Ukraine fahren mÃ¼ssen.

DarÃ¼ber hinaus kennt das Rechtssystem in den Separatistengebieten nur untere Gerichte, was bedeutet, dass ÃœberprÃ¼fungen durch hÃ¶here Instanzgerichte nicht mÃ¶glich sind. Angeklagt werden kann man hier auch wegen proukrainischer Meinungen.

Manche kommen durch

Es soll Freelancer geben, die einen Weg Ã¼ber Russland in die Kriegsgebiete fanden, indem sie mit dem Zug von Kiew nach Charkow gereist sind und von dort mit einem Ã¼blichen Sammeltaxi (Marschrutka) die Grenze passiert und ohne Akkreditierung in das Konfliktgebiet gefunden haben, wozu allerdings ein russisches Visum gehÃ¶rt.

Gewarnt wurde auf den n-Ost-Podium allerdings nachdrÃ¼cklich vor solchen Pfaden. So etwas kÃ¶nne schlimmstenfalls als Spionage ausgelegt werden und im GefÃ¤ngnis enden, hieÃŸ es. Bei freien Journalisten, die so etwas tun, setzt sich auch selten eine Redaktion ein und auch die normale deutsche Krankenversicherung ist im UnglÃ¼cksfall nicht ausreichend.

Legal geschafft bis nach Donezk und Lugansk hat es aber auf jeden Fall kÃ¼rzlich das Ã¶sterreichische Fernsehen ORF.

Die Reporter erfuhren dort von einer Babuschka, wie die GroÃŸmÃ¼tter in Russland liebevoll genannt werden, das Donald Trump das Leben im Donbass bald besser machen wird.

____

Ihr habt auch ein spannendes Thema?

Die HuffPost ist eine Debattenplattform fÃ¼r alle Perspektiven. Wenn ihr die Diskussion zu politischen oder gesellschaftlichen Themen vorantreiben wollt, schickt eure Idee an unser Blog-Team unter blog@huffingtonpost.de.
TITLE: Ostukraine: Berichterstattung aus dem No-Go Land

TEXT:
Die Nato hat in Europa nach eigener EinschÃ¤tzung massive logistische Probleme

Im Ernstfall wÃ¤re es schwierig, Personal und Material zum Einsatzort zu bringen

Stellt euch vor, es ist Krieg, und die Nato kommt nicht hin.

Glaubt man internen Nato-Dokumenten, dann ist das ein realistisches Szenario. Das MilitÃ¤rbÃ¼ndnis kÃ¶nnte seine Mitglieder im Ernstfall nicht wirksam verteidigen, weil die Logistik schlecht organisiert und aufgestellt ist. Das geht aus einem geheimen Papier des westlichen BÃ¼ndnisses hervor, Ã¼ber das das Nachrichtenmagazin "Der Spiegel" am Samstag berichtet.

Was alles nicht klappt

Das Papier trÃ¤gt den sperrigen Namen "Fortschrittsbericht Ã¼ber das verstÃ¤rkte Abschreckungs- und Verteidigungsdispositiv der Allianz" und listet laut "Spiegel" massive MÃ¤ngel auf:

â–º Kommandostrukturen: Der Verantwortungsbereich des Nato-Oberbefehlshabers fÃ¼r Europa sei so aufgestellt, dass nicht einmal die speziell fÃ¼r solche FÃ¤lle gedachte Nato-Eingreiftruppe in der Lage sei, schnell und nachhaltig zu reagieren.

â–º GerÃ¤t: Dem Bericht nach fehlen die GerÃ¤te, um schwere Kampfmittel wie Panzer zu transportieren â€“ das betreffe Tieflader und Bahnwaggons, auÃŸerdem braucht es zum Transport BrÃ¼cken, die das hohe Gewicht tragen kÃ¶nnen.

â–º Sichere Nachschubwege: Der Nachschub Ã¼ber den Atlantik ist wichtig fÃ¼r einen Kriegsfall in Europa. Doch dort soll das russische MilitÃ¤r weit besser aufgestellt sein als die Nato.

â–º Fehlende Ãœbung: Das Magazin zitiert einen Nato-General, der sagte, nach dem Kalten Krieg habe man "das Bewegen von Truppen schlicht verlernt". Das ist umso bedenklicher, als die Nato zwar Truppen nach Estland, Lettland und Litauen verlegt hat, das aber bei einer Konfrontation mit Russland nicht reichen wÃ¼rde.

â–º BÃ¼rokratie: Bevor Nato-Soldaten in den MitgliedslÃ¤ndern Grenzen passieren dÃ¼rfen, ist erst einmal Papierkram fÃ¤llig. Es fehlen einheitliche Formulare. Und die BehÃ¶rden kÃ¶nnen darauf bestehen, dass die Seriennummer jedes einzelnen MilitÃ¤r-Lkws oder Panzers aufgelistet wird.

So berichtet das US-Magazin "Defense One" , dass das zweite Kavallerieregiment der US-StreitkrÃ¤fte im Rahmen einer internationalen Ãœbung im Sommer mit einem Konvoi von Deutschland nach Georgien fahren sollte. In RumÃ¤nien saÃŸen die Soldaten eineinhalb Stunden an der Grenze fest, bevor die Grenzer hÃ¤ndisch die Papiere abgestempelt hatten und die Soldaten ausreisen durften.

US-General Steven Shapiro sagte dem "Spiegel", derlei Vorschriften seien auch im Kriegsfall nicht automatisch auÃŸer Kraft gesetzt.

Was nÃ¼tzt das Material, wenn es nicht an den Einsatzort kommt?

Das heiÃŸt: Selbst die besten militÃ¤rischen und finanziellen Mittel nutzen der Nato wenig, wenn sie ihre Truppen samt AusrÃ¼stung im Ernstfall nicht schnell dorthin bringen kann, wo sie gebraucht werden.

Die Nato weiÃŸ um die MÃ¤ngel, die Kommandostrukturen werden reformiert. Doch das dauert.

Nato-General: Russische Invasion im Baltikum "sehr unwahrscheinlich"

Zwar rechnet derzeit kaum jemand mit einem groÃŸen Angriff Russlands auf europÃ¤ische Staaten. Aber insbesondere die baltischen Staaten sehen mit Sorge, wie Russland seinen Einfluss nach Westen ausdehnt.

Der Kommandeur des US-Heeres in Europa, Ben Hodges, sagte jÃ¼ngst zum VerhÃ¤ltnis der Nato-Staaten mit Russland: "Wir wollen die TÃ¼r fÃ¼r Russland offen halten - absolut." Es gebe einige Felder, "wo wir einander brauchen". MÃ¶glich sei etwa ein gemeinsames Vorgehen im Kampf gegen den Menschenhandel. "Und ich wÃ¼rde gern wieder Hockey spielen und zusammen Ã¼ben", sagte Hodges.

"Aber Russland hat Gewalt angewendet, um die Grenze eines europÃ¤ischen Landes zu verÃ¤ndern. Das war nicht akzeptabel", sagte er mit Blick auf die von Russland 2014 einverleibte ukrainische Halbinsel Krim.

Ziel bleibe es, Russland abzuschrecken, den osteuropÃ¤ischen VerbÃ¼ndeten Sicherheit zu garantieren und die Interessen der USA zu schÃ¼tzen. Die Partner seien heute gut aufgestellt - mit trainierten und effektiven multinationalen Formationen, die Ã¼ber eine gute Infrastruktur verfÃ¼gten. Mit Blick auf die MilitÃ¤rmanÃ¶ver in den baltischen Staaten sagte Hodges, dass es wichtig sei, PrÃ¤senz zu zeigen. Eine russische Invasion im Baltikum bezeichnete er aber als "sehr unwahrscheinlich".

Mit Materia von dpa

Drone footage from Raqqa on Thursday showed the extent of the devastation caused by weeks of fighting between Kurdish-led Syrian Democratic Forces (SDF) and so-called Islamic State militants.
Entire neighbourhoods are seen turned to rubble, with little sign of civilian life having survived the fighting.
On Tuesday, the Kurdish-led SDF said that military operations in Raqqa have ended and that their troops have taken full control of the city.

TEXT:
Twitter users are gleefully poking fun at Donald Trump Jr. after he posted a bizarre image of his father as a superhero online.

President Donald Trumpâ€™s eldest son shared this fake Time magazine cover to Instagram on Friday night:

A post shared by Donald Trump Jr. (@donaldjtrumpjr) on Oct 20, 2017 at 6:12pm PDT

It showed a bearded Trump wearing a Superman-style costume with the letter â€œTâ€ instead of â€œSâ€ emblazoned across his chest.

The post caught the attention of Twitter user @goldengateblond, who couldnâ€™t quite believe her eyes:

what in the wide world of fuck is this pic.twitter.com/MGoe47dKZV â€” shauna (@goldengateblond) October 21, 2017

Her tweet went viral, and fellow Twitter users couldnâ€™t help joining in.

Some referenced Timeâ€™s asking of the Trump Organization to remove fake covers of the magazine on display at the presidential familyâ€™s business properties. Others, meanwhile, called it a â€œfresh hellâ€ and â€œdisturbing.â€

A search through Timeâ€™s cover archive proves that it is indeed bogus.

Hereâ€™s a sampling of the responses:

This is the least fresh hell I've ever seen â€” Alicia Lutes (@alicialutes) October 21, 2017

Hmmm... Was it hanging in the lobby at Mar-a-Lago? â€” William Wallace (@TheAppresident) October 21, 2017

Why does he have a beard Superman doesn't have a beard â€” OhNoSheTwitnt (@OhNoSheTwitnt) October 21, 2017

DC Comics should sue. â€” Abhay (1-1) (@sfwarriorsfan) October 21, 2017

Alt-right porn is so weird. â€” David Jenkins (@scriptdave) October 21, 2017

Disturbing is what it is â€” Michael Wotton (@iamtheclownto) October 21, 2017

It's Russian art work. Not quite a genuine Renoir but... â€” ğŸ» Mike (@BuffaloBearGuy) October 21, 2017

Itâ€™s the most amazing example of a magazine ever. Thereâ€™s NEVER been a cover more amazing. Itâ€™s bigley amazing! It hangs in my golf clubs! pic.twitter.com/5IqSUFdAny â€” Kimberley (@HappilyKim) October 21, 2017

Heroic(ly tone-deaf and uncomfortably weird.) â€” Dominic D'Andrea (@DominicDAndrea) October 21, 2017

Just another fake time magazine cover â€” Jerry James Stone (@jerryjamesstone) October 21, 2017

Oh fantastic, the nightmare diary gets another entry pic.twitter.com/VWERmqmyUq â€” Courtney Nickerson (@SavageBeauty747) October 21, 2017

I'll never be able to look at Superman the same way now. Dammit, Trump! â€” Mario Puccinelli (@MariothePolWonk) October 21, 2017

Bad Santa ğŸ… â€” Lana Lakke (@LanaLakke) October 21, 2017

This,... is the beginning of the end. â€” The Guess Who (@_Mitchey_) October 21, 2017

I've heard of an Oedipus and Electra complex but this is beyond Freud â€” Andrea Aguirre (@sumo_andy) October 21, 2017
TITLE: Donald Trump Jr. Just Shared The Weirdest Picture Of His Dad
